page.title: 03Population of Marston
page.content: There were seventy seven different types of housing surveyed. Forty one of these were privately owned, twenty three rented and thirteen tied. The average number of occupants in each household was two point five persons. There were thirty two children at school or college. The approximate length of time the longest resident had lived in the village was seventy nine years. There were twenty people who have lived in the village 50 years or longer. Ninety three people have employment approx. 14 per cent of these being self employed, with some part time workers. Weekly shopping is bought mainly in Banbury. Mobile traders include a grocer and butcher. The village shop and post office has recently closed.
